data.text: @feebee12049893 @doctorasadkhan @Ceri_turns @bobbyelmo2007 @Mrsljn Yes it is, you are right. @mjb302 @CathNoakes @chrischirp @Kit_Yates_Maths It's best that the air of the room is treated with combined actions/mechanisms. The #indoorairquality science reveals clearly that both replacing air (#ventilation) & removing particles from the air (#filtration) are needed. A balance can be achieved that ensures ⬆️healthy air.

@XXanMM @doctorasadkhan @Ceri_turns @bobbyelmo2007 @Mrsljn The whole point of John’s thread is that though the IFR is similar to flu, the higher R0 means that 
“Covid is still adding to mortality risk above and beyond a bad flu season.”

@doctorasadkhan @Ceri_turns @bobbyelmo2007 @Mrsljn Agree with John that we are entering religion like territory with such push strong back by a small minority on the improving prognosis. Apologies, but there will never be zero long term negatives of a new endemic respiratory virus that will be here forever https://t.co/JoCqRJw1UG

@Ceri_turns @XXanMM @bobbyelmo2007 @Mrsljn Mortality is not the only outcome. There is serious underreporting with no requirement to test now. And of course vaccines are only one public health measure. You can still get infected. When will people realise this.
